in a way that is very wide, or very empty: gapingly wide This was an era when the chasm between the rich and poor was gapingly wide. The goalkeeper presented him with a gapingly open goal.
More examplesFewer examplesClosing the educational attainment gap was the party's big commitment, but it remains gapingly wide.The drama, played out on a gapingly wide stage, tries to pack in a bit too much action.There was no money to buy food, and the shelves of their cupboards were gapingly empty.
